articles.author: Surfer
articles.description:
RT Scott Johnsson
March '21/'22 cases with decisions within 160 days of oral: 30/32 (94%)
Days since Grayscale (March '23) oral: 160 days
Why should we expect August? Because law clerks for DC generally cycle in/out this month, so judges aim to clear prior caseload before the new guard arrives.

Scott Johnsson: All of the March 2022 decided cases argued in front of the DC Cir were done within 154 days (save one outlier at 170 days). It's been 156 days since Grayscale was argued and there's only a small handful of remaining undecided March-argued cases.
articles.title: RT Scott Johnsson: March '21/'22 cases with decisions within 160 days of oral: 30/32 (94%) Days since Grayscale (March '23) oral: 160 days Why should ...

articles.description:
Brian Baldstrong is endorsing onchain summer. 
What is even happening 😜

Brian Armstrong 🛡️: One thing #OnchainSummer is exposing is just how broken our UX is in the main Coinbase app for NFTs, Dapps, and L2s today. Sorry to say, but true.
If we face truth, we can get motivated to improve it. These need to be first class experiences, and #OnchainSummer is a great impetus…

articles.description:
RT Gabor Gurbacs
The average U.S. annual income in 1971 paid off a house in ~2.5 years, could buy 3 new cars in a year, send 4 kids to Harvard in a year and easily afford food, shelter, necessities and entertainment.
The older generation doesn’t understand the difficulties the young face today.
